intro: Chlamydocarya glabrescens, commonly known as the smoothleaf chlamydocarya, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels, a common floral arrangement in the Apiaceae family. Chlamydocarya glabrescens is often found in sagebrush steppe and desert scrub habitats.
